Description: Brief, near-maximal effort hangs (typically 4–10 seconds) using added weight or very small edges to build maximum finger strength and tendon adaptations. Focuses on neuromuscular recruitment and requires long rests (3–5+ min). Recommended 1–2 sessions per week.

Low.Description: Introduction to max hangs or lower intensity phase. Focus on form with a challenging but manageable load.

5.EstimatedWorkoutTime: Approx 5 min hanging work block (excluding warm-up/long rests)

10.EstimatedWorkoutTime: Approx 10 min hanging work block (excluding warm-up/long rests)

15.EstimatedWorkoutTime: Approx 15 min hanging work block (excluding warm-up/long rests)

20.EstimatedWorkoutTime: Approx 20 min hanging work block (excluding warm-up/long rests)

Medium.Description: Standard max hang intensity close to the 7–10 second maximum. Focus is on near-maximal loads with clear progression.

5.EstimatedWorkoutTime: Approx 5 min hanging work block (excluding warm-up/long rests)

10.EstimatedWorkoutTime: Approx 10 min hanging work block (excluding warm-up/long rests)

15.EstimatedWorkoutTime: Approx 15 min hanging work block (excluding warm-up/long rests)

20.EstimatedWorkoutTime: Approx 20 min hanging work block (excluding warm-up/long rests)

High.Description: Pushing limits with maximal added weight or minimum edge size. Recommended only for advanced users.

5.EstimatedWorkoutTime: Approx 5 min hanging work block (excluding warm-up/long rests)

10.EstimatedWorkoutTime: Approx 10 min hanging work block (excluding warm-up/long rests)

Exercises.Intensity_Modifier: Near-maximal added weight for the edge

15.EstimatedWorkoutTime: Approx 15 min hanging work block (excluding warm-up/long rests)

20.EstimatedWorkoutTime: Approx 20 min hanging work block (excluding warm-up/long rests)

Description: Hangs lasting 10-20+ seconds, often bodyweight on challenging edges or with moderate added weight. Develops strength-endurance and fatigue resistance. Requires 1.5-3 min rest between hangs.

Low.Description: Focus on longer duration with easier holds or assistance.

Medium.Description: Challenging bodyweight hangs on smaller edges or moderate added weight on medium edges.

High.Description: Pushing duration limits on small edges or with significant weight. Eva López 'Minimum Edge' style fits here.

Exercises.Description: Half-Crimp on Minimum Edge (Specific to protocol)
Half-Crimp on Minimum Edge (Specific to protocol)
Half-Crimp on Minimum Edge (Specific to protocol)
Open Hand (Drag) on Minimum Edge (Specific to protocol)
Half-Crimp on Minimum Edge (Specific to protocol)
Open Hand (Drag) on Minimum Edge (Specific to protocol)

Description: Interval protocol: 7 seconds hang followed by 3 seconds rest, repeated 6 times per set. Primarily targets local forearm endurance and recovery. Typically uses moderate intensity (bodyweight or light weight/assist) and 3 min rest between sets.

Low.Description: Focus on completing sets with good form, using larger holds or assistance.

Medium.Description: Standard intensity, challenging bodyweight on medium holds or light added weight.

High.Description: Increased difficulty via smaller holds or added weight, pushing endurance limits.

Description: Interval protocol: 6 seconds hang, 10 seconds rest, repeated 5 times per set. Longer rest allows higher intensity (added weight/smaller hold), targeting power-endurance.

Low.Description: Introduction to the format, moderate intensity.

Medium.Description: Using significant added weight or smaller holds to make hangs challenging.

High.Description: Near maximal hangs within the repeater format, using very small holds or heavy weight.

Description: Interval protocol: 10 seconds hang, 5 seconds rest, often 4 reps per set (similar total hang time to 7:3). Targets endurance, slightly longer rest allows chalking. Can be high volume (10-20 sets total mentioned).

Low.Description: Focus on completing sets with good form, using larger holds or assistance.

Medium.Description: Standard intensity, challenging bodyweight on medium holds or light added weight. Aim for multiple sets.

High.Description: Increased difficulty via smaller holds or added weight, aiming for high volume (approaching 10-20 total sets for longer durations).

Description: Daily or twice-daily routine involving ~10 minutes of cumulative, very low-intensity hangs (e.g., 10s on / 20s off), often with feet providing support (~30-50% bodyweight). Aims to frequently stimulate tendon adaptation with minimal stress.

Low.Description: The intended use of this protocol - very light, frequent stimulus.

Medium.Description: Not the primary intended use. Could involve slightly smaller holds or less foot support, but still submaximal.

High.Description: Not applicable. This protocol is defined by low intensity.

Description: Very light hangs performed on rest days to promote blood flow and maintain tendon conditioning. Intensity should be very low (~40-50% max load or RPE <5/10), using large holds or assistance. Goal is recovery, not fatigue.

Low.Description: The intended use - very light, short duration to aid recovery.

Medium.Description: Not applicable. Intensity should remain low for recovery.

High.Description: Not applicable. Intensity should remain low for recovery.
